content.text: Alt. "Now is the Season is a unique, character-driven, narrative-adventure game impeded (very deliberately) by the game's own cast of characters."
content.markdown: Alt. "Now is the Season is a unique, character-driven, narrative-adventure game impeded (very deliberately) by the game's own cast of characters."

content.text: Mechanics let the player 'affect' the directionality of conversation.
content.markdown: Mechanics let the player 'affect' the directionality of conversation.

content.text: The words someone uses (what they actually say) [...] 'matter-less' than what is being expressed (what they actually mean)
content.markdown: The words someone uses (what they actually say) [...] 'matter-less' than what is being expressed (what they actually mean)

content.text: Spend time reading real-world books - Not too Heavy
content.markdown: Spend time reading real-world books - Not too Heavy

content.text: Mechanical incentives to staying home and resting
content.markdown: Mechanical incentives to staying home and resting

content.text: Social meter - When talking to an npc can decline Autumn's social meter, which in-turn, reduces the opportunities for positive outcomes. (this is a dietetic system) The way Autumn ends conversations gives the player a feel for her state of mind.
content.markdown: Social meter - When talking to an npc can decline Autumn's social meter, which in-turn, reduces the opportunities for positive outcomes. (this is a dietetic system) The way Autumn ends conversations gives the player a feel for her state of mind.

content.text: The social meter- refills at home doing small house activities & tasks. Like reading, cleaning, dressing up, and decorating.
content.markdown: The social meter- refills at home doing small house activities & tasks. Like reading, cleaning, dressing up, and decorating.

content.text: Beseech them with demands, offer nothing but reproach, and the whole will soon be rid of you.
content.markdown: Beseech them with demands, offer nothing but reproach, and the whole will soon be rid of you.

content.text: Can be at a loss of spirit
content.markdown: Can be at a loss of spirit

content.text: "Who is more generous in strength, courage, and heart than Spring?!"
content.markdown: "Who is more generous in strength, courage, and heart than Spring?!"

content.text: (red text) Growing up, guardians commend her for being 'pure', well-tempered, and obedient.
content.markdown: (red text) Growing up, guardians commend her for being 'pure', well-tempered, and obedient.

content.text: (list) High water levels, Flooding events, Heavy rainfall, Lightning storms, Muted, but colorful
content.markdown: (list) High water levels, Flooding events, Heavy rainfall, Lightning storms, Muted, but colorful

content.text: (list) Heat waves/drought, Falling/fallen trees, Lower water levels, Spontaneous fires
content.markdown: (list) Heat waves/drought, Falling/fallen trees, Lower water levels, Spontaneous fires

content.text: No one may do it better than him
content.markdown: No one may do it better than him

content.text: Owes [them] nothing if it's not to himself or his reputation
content.markdown: Owes [them] nothing if it's not to himself or his reputation

content.text: (red text) What does society tell him he is owed? Is he irate for it?
content.markdown: (red text) What does society tell him he is owed? Is he irate for it?

content.text: the notion of live; is not the thing he has an awareness of
content.markdown: the notion of live; is not the thing he has an awareness of

content.text: Leaves strewn around the game world are deliberate resource to help Autumn navigate her environment. The game will 'hint-at-her' to move using the blowing of leaves; the sound that the wind makes, the [physical effect] of twigs being pulled by the Unseen force.
content.markdown: Leaves strewn around the game world are deliberate resource to help Autumn navigate her environment. The game will 'hint-at-her' to move using the blowing of leaves; the sound that the wind makes, the [physical effect] of twigs being pulled by the Unseen force.

content.text: When Autumn enters or exits doors, the game saves; players can return to a previous save intuitively
content.markdown: When Autumn enters or exits doors, the game saves; players can return to a previous save intuitively

content.text: Prayer to her as if to the saints
content.markdown: Prayer to her as if to the saints

content.text: To desire [for] great virtue in your children
content.markdown: To desire [for] great virtue in your children

content.text: At expense [of] their sense of identity and worth
content.markdown: At expense [of] their sense of identity and worth

content.text: What worth is it [of a parent] to pity a child?
content.markdown: What worth is it [of a parent] to pity a child?

content.text: (red text) No real presence in Autumn's life.
content.markdown: (red text) No real presence in Autumn's life.

content.text: (red text) "To give yourself away for free."
content.markdown: (red text) "To give yourself away for free."

content.text: (red text?) "you are meant (made) to care for your village"
content.markdown: (red text?) "you are meant (made) to care for your village"

content.text: Characteristically good-willed: Instilled in her are the beliefs of her parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, cousins, sisters, and brothers. Beliefs about herself and the role she is meant to play. Beliefs about her body and identity and what social obligations they entail society.
content.markdown: Characteristically good-willed: Instilled in her are the beliefs of her parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, cousins, sisters, and brothers. Beliefs about herself and the role she is meant to play. Beliefs about her body and identity and what social obligations they entail society.

content.text: (red text) Regarded religiously by the townspeople
content.markdown: (red text) Regarded religiously by the townspeople

content.text: Knowing this role is not hers to choose
content.markdown: Knowing this role is not hers to choose

content.text: A deep love of all living things
content.markdown: A deep love of all living things

content.text: Accepting of the cycles of life and death
content.markdown: Accepting of the cycles of life and death

content.text: (red text?) Autumn is to balance her life among others
content.markdown: (red text?) Autumn is to balance her life among others

content.text: Has the potential to express either a deep sense of responsibility or a deep disdain for her role
content.markdown: Has the potential to express either a deep sense of responsibility or a deep disdain for her role

content.text: Run at full speed into a leaf pie to leap into it or walk up to the edge of a leaf pile (gently step towards it) to 'fall, arms outstretched' into the pile. Both actions yield collectibles. (Falling lightly does not toss leafs everywhere as throwing yourself into it does)
content.markdown: Run at full speed into a leaf pie to leap into it or walk up to the edge of a leaf pile (gently step towards it) to 'fall, arms outstretched' into the pile. Both actions yield collectibles. (Falling lightly does not toss leafs everywhere as throwing yourself into it does)

content.text: (list) Frozen lakes, Snow & snow storms, Icicles & Icy rivers, Elevation change, Hibernating creatures, Stillness Quietude
content.markdown: (list) Frozen lakes, Snow & snow storms, Icicles & Icy rivers, Elevation change, Hibernating creatures, Stillness Quietude

content.text: Quickly travel across frozen lakes and rivers.
content.markdown: Quickly travel across frozen lakes and rivers.

content.text: Jump into sparkling snow. Proximity activation of interaction like the leaf-piles.
content.markdown: Jump into sparkling snow. Proximity activation of interaction like the leaf-piles.

content.text: Seasons as companion characters with a "sense of autonomy. & agency."
content.markdown: Seasons as companion characters with a "sense of autonomy. & agency."

content.text: Social tension as the core mechanic. "Like a game of tug-of-rope."
content.markdown: Social tension as the core mechanic. "Like a game of tug-of-rope."

content.text: An Old Father plants trees in the sunlight; bearing nature, sustaining them, nurturing them until they are fully firm;
content.markdown: An Old Father plants trees in the sunlight; bearing nature, sustaining them, nurturing them until they are fully firm;

content.text: Generous, plain, 'at ability to work'; a Daughter; bearing witness to "the gift" of The Mother Herself.
content.markdown: Generous, plain, 'at ability to work'; a Daughter; bearing witness to "the gift" of The Mother Herself.

content.text: "Mother's guidance." Dear; (he unfurls a child wrapped in a silken blanket) (there is an 'aura' to the child, and the room is filled with an apparent glow) Autumn. [glances; 'handing her the child'] Given to us [as] mortal parents [in her] upbringing and care. "We are foretold to great things, dear Bea!" She RETREATS! "Dear, Beatrice!" [stammers] HER NAME IS AUTUMN.. AND THE GODS BEAR US AS HER GUARDIANS; [WE ARE TO ADOPT HER; EDUCATE HER; SHE WILL BE MET WITH SISTERS, BEATRICE!] Bea. Beatrice.. [one hand outstretched for the woman; the other cradling the (almost glowing) child wrapped in a soft-silk blanket. The good mother [Mother Nature] has graced us. [he hands her the child] [she embraces it] [looks] [searches]
content.markdown: "Mother's guidance." Dear; (he unfurls a child wrapped in a silken blanket) (there is an 'aura' to the child, and the room is filled with an apparent glow) Autumn. [glances; 'handing her the child'] Given to us [as] mortal parents [in her] upbringing and care. "We are foretold to great things, dear Bea!" She RETREATS! "Dear, Beatrice!" [stammers] HER NAME IS AUTUMN.. AND THE GODS BEAR US AS HER GUARDIANS; [WE ARE TO ADOPT HER; EDUCATE HER; SHE WILL BE MET WITH SISTERS, BEATRICE!] Bea. Beatrice.. [one hand outstretched for the woman; the other cradling the (almost glowing) child wrapped in a soft-silk blanket. The good mother [Mother Nature] has graced us. [he hands her the child] [she embraces it] [looks] [searches]

content.title: New Note
content.text: 35. Whenever you do something you have decided ought to be done, never try to avoid being seen doing it, even if people in general may disapprove of it. If, of course, your action is wrong, just dont do it at all; but if its right, why be afraid of people whose criticism is off the mark?
content.markdown: 35. Whenever you do something you have decided ought to be done, never try to avoid being seen doing it, even if people in general may disapprove of it. If, of course, your action is wrong, just dont do it at all; but if its right, why be afraid of people whose criticism is off the mark?

content.title: New Note
content.text: 38. You are careful in walking not to step on a nail or twist your ankle, and you should be just as careful to do no harm to your commanding-faculty. If we stick to this rule in every action, we shall perform what we are doing more securely.
content.markdown: 38. You are careful in walking not to step on a nail or twist your ankle, and you should be just as careful to do no harm to your commanding-faculty. If we stick to this rule in every action, we shall perform what we are doing more securely.

content.title: New Note
content.text: 37. If you have taken on a *role beyond your capacity, you have demeaned yourself in it, and you have also passed up the role you could have filled creditably.
content.markdown: 37. If you have taken on a *role beyond your capacity, you have demeaned yourself in it, and you have also passed up the role you could have filled creditably.

content.title: New Note
content.text:
42. Whenever people treat you badly or criticize you, remember that they are only doing and saying what they think is appropriate for them. They cannot take their lead from your opinion but only from their own. So if their opinion is incorrect, they are the people who suffer harm because they are the ones who got it wrong. When someone takes a true *conjunctive statement to be false, no harm is done to the statement but only to the person making the mistake. If you start out from this position, you will be indulgent to your critics, and tell yourself
each time, Thats what they thought.
content.markdown:
42. Whenever people treat you badly or criticize you, remember that they are only doing and saying what they think is appropriate for them. They cannot take their lead from your opinion but only from their own. So if their opinion is incorrect, they are the people who suffer harm because they are the ones who got it wrong. When someone takes a true *conjunctive statement to be false, no harm is done to the statement but only to the person making the mistake. If you start out from this position, you will be indulgent to your critics, and tell yourself
each time, Thats what they thought.

content.title: New Note
content.text: 48. The stance and hallmark of ordinary persons is never looking for help or harm from themselves, but only from things that are on the outside. The stance and hallmark of philosophers is only looking for help and harm from themselves. The signs of a person making progress are these: criticizing nobody, praising nobody, blaming nobody, accusing nobody, and saying nothing about oneself to indicate being someone or knowing something. Whenever such a person is frustrated or impeded, he accuses himself. If hes complimented, he laughs to himself at the one paying the compliment, and if hes criticized, he doesnt defend himself. He goes around like a patient, taking care not to injure any of his recovering limbs before they are fully firm. He has banished all desire, and he has transferred his aversion to the naturally disagreeable things that are up to us. He is relaxed in all his motivations. He doesnt care if he appears simple-minded or ignorant. In a word, he keeps watch on himself as though he were his own enemy plotting an attack.
content.markdown: 48. The stance and hallmark of ordinary persons is never looking for help or harm from themselves, but only from things that are on the outside. The stance and hallmark of philosophers is only looking for help and harm from themselves. The signs of a person making progress are these: criticizing nobody, praising nobody, blaming nobody, accusing nobody, and saying nothing about oneself to indicate being someone or knowing something. Whenever such a person is frustrated or impeded, he accuses himself. If hes complimented, he laughs to himself at the one paying the compliment, and if hes criticized, he doesnt defend himself. He goes around like a patient, taking care not to injure any of his recovering limbs before they are fully firm. He has banished all desire, and he has transferred his aversion to the naturally disagreeable things that are up to us. He is relaxed in all his motivations. He doesnt care if he appears simple-minded or ignorant. In a word, he keeps watch on himself as though he were his own enemy plotting an attack.

content.text: The player can collect clothing items for customization and expression. Bracelets, hair ties, belts, shoestrings; multiple sashes/backpacks, and various buttons and pins to decorate the containers with. Autumn can swap out her boots, tie back her hair, dye it, add or change her piercings, and choose whether she wants to wear makeup/eyeliner.
content.markdown: The player can collect clothing items for customization and expression. Bracelets, hair ties, belts, shoestrings; multiple sashes/backpacks, and various buttons and pins to decorate the containers with. Autumn can swap out her boots, tie back her hair, dye it, add or change her piercings, and choose whether she wants to wear makeup/eyeliner.

content.text: How punk is she; How 'complaint' is she?
content.markdown: How punk is she; How 'complaint' is she?

content.text: Clothing as a characterization of the player's wants and expectations.
content.markdown: Clothing as a characterization of the player's wants and expectations.

content.text: ALL MAY REQUEST OF YOU, THIS IS IMPLICIT
content.markdown: ALL MAY REQUEST OF YOU, THIS IS IMPLICIT

content.text: (blue text) No patriarchal advice is "good" advice,
content.markdown: (blue text) No patriarchal advice is "good" advice,

content.text: What amount of giving is good? What amounts to an empty heart?
content.markdown: What amount of giving is good? What amounts to an empty heart?

content.text: Autumn is giving connection. (purple text) People will also take in this way.
content.markdown: Autumn is giving connection. (purple text) People will also take in this way.

content.text: A role you have no choice but to endure in.
content.markdown: A role you have no choice but to endure in.

content.text: There is no 'protecting us' from what we are.
content.markdown: There is no 'protecting us' from what we are.

content.text: We just have to turn to ourselves and face it.
content.markdown: We just have to turn to ourselves and face it.

content.text: (blue text) How do [our parent's expectations] shape us?
content.markdown: (blue text) How do [our parent's expectations] shape us?

content.text: (red text) People will expect of you, demand of you.
content.markdown: (red text) People will expect of you, demand of you.

content.text: (red text) "What amount of connection is needed, what amount of connection is necessary," how could anyone ever choose to give less?
content.markdown: (red text) "What amount of connection is needed, what amount of connection is necessary," how could anyone ever choose to give less?

content.text: "There cannot be deep disappointment without deep love."
content.markdown: "There cannot be deep disappointment without deep love."
content._html_backup: "There cannot be deep disappointment without deep love."

content.text: [...] the illusion to [any change in the world] is the illusion that man is but one person.
content.markdown: \[...\] the illusion to \[any change in the world\] is the illusion that man is but one person.
content._html_backup: [...] the illusion to [any change in the world] is the illusion that man is but one person.

content.text: What is the 'just' measure of time spent? (in idle worship of the self) (what amount is spent on others?)
content.markdown: What is the 'just' measure of time spent? (*in idle worship of the self*)*(what amount* is spent on others?)
content._html_backup: What is the 'just' measure of time spent? (in idle worship of the self) (what amount is spent on others?)

content.text: Is the idea that [time spent] with people [time not spent] making money something supportable by [centrist] parliamentarian goals?
content.markdown: Is the idea that [time spent] with people [time not spent] making money something supportable by [centrist] parliamentarian goals?

content.text: To: "mold the intolerance and monstrosity of [unreconstructed] wayward men into a human-shape."
content.markdown: To: "mold the intolerance and monstrosity of \[unreconstructed\] wayward men into a human-shape."
content._html_backup: To: "mold the intolerance and monstrosity of [unreconstructed] wayward men into a human-shape."

content.text: There is feeling comfortable And then there is feeling complacent. Indignity ought only ever be righteous.
content.markdown: There is feeling comfortable And then there is feeling complacent. Indignity ought only ever be righteous.

content.text: The whole are not an impediment to the body, to the mind, to the soul,
content.markdown: The whole are not an impediment to the body, to the mind, to the soul,

content.text: Without the whole we could not live as we do.
content.markdown: Without the whole we could not live as we do.

content.text: "The only obstacle to change is the illusion we are an individual.
content.markdown: "The only obstacle to change is the illusion we are an individual.

content.text: How tall do you feel around people? This person, in particular?
content.markdown: How tall do you feel around people? This person, in particular?

content.text: In 'not measuring up', we might pity ourselves; resent our lot. No progress is being made here.
content.markdown: In 'not measuring up', we might pity ourselves; resent our lot. No progress is being made here.

content.text: (purple text) Why do we [look up]? What are man's highest ideals?
content.markdown: (purple text) Why do we [look up]? What are man's highest ideals?

content.markdown: (list) What discontents us?, What discomforts us?, What disaffects us?, What makes us feel alone?, What makes us feel a stranger?, What makes us feel regret?, What makes us feel shame?, What makes us feel frustration?, What makes us feel love?, What makes us feel hate?

content.markdown: (red text) What of our behavior is taught implicitly?

content.text: Be aware of how you ask for the player's attention. Respect the player's time and intelligence.
